result.execSummary:
The defendant George Alton Ridyard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. George Alton Ridyard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • George Alton Ridyard was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

02:39 PM Defendant George Alton Ridyard in court with attorney Amy M Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached, uncharged referral being read in.    Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count 1  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 2
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days  in Dane County Jail, with Huber; to commence on 9/30/22  at   7:00 am 

-Days credit for time served:  3 days
-Days credit to jail: 3 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct 2
-DA surcharge
-DNA surchare waived
-All CC, DA surcharge due w/in 60 days. 




-The Court orders DNA sample



-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

02:05 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
